Review.Titre: Not a single location is working
Review.Contenu: Not a single location is working. All of them return "Failed to connect to shortcut" "Please check your network connection." message, even though my internet is fine.Also, i get the support for Ukraine, i support them myself, but i don't want unremovable shortcuts and banners within the app, it feels forcing. At least put an option to hide them.And to top it all, I never received the confirmation email.Will be cancelling the my free trial on the first day.

This is a disaster or maybe I am missing a huge “How-To?” These "shortcuts" are horrible in that it's one or the other? I want full and complete protection all the time and know that when the ClearVPN is on (which is hard to know because my IP address was showing to the world, yet I "was protected!") I am fully protected AT ALL TIMES. To wit: my IP is ALWAYS masked; my DNS queries are encrypted and using one server not 11; my connection is blocking all trackers, ads, and malware; I want to change my location on the whim and not anything else all these other safety measures are always in effect. I am flabbergasted by this non-intuitive, poorly implemented VPN coming from MacPaw (yes, it's in beta so heed this critique, it is practical). What of the protocols: Stealth, WireGuard (UDP, TCP), OpenVPN (UDP, TCP), Smart, IKEv2? What about access/blocking LAN connections? How can I connect to the Fastest Connection while maintaining full security? Any outside reviewers on data storage? What happens when you receive a do not notify warrant? How about a walk-through video on how to use? a 7-day trial is not enough for a full review of ClearVPN and how it works/doesn't work. Make some changes, quickly. PS: There are numerous grammar and syntax errors on your site that need to be addressed post haste.

I've been trying to use ClearVPN for over a year now but with every attempt to activate a shortcut or just log in, there is a problem that takes time to resolve. In the worst case, like today, we give up making it work on the devices we want to and accept the fact that we just spend 30 min of our lives trying to make a product we paid for work.In the best case, I start communicating with the support and after 3 days or so of emails back and forth, the app works. Till 2 days later, when I have to re-install it again. I like the company and their idea with nifty shortcuts, but am getting so frustrated with the product that feels so unstable across all my devices, that consirder asking for money back. Too bad!   Yet another day I decide to dedicate anothe 3 min to write the review.
worse customer experience ever. Paid for 3 months, never been able to use it and never got back to me.After 3 months, they contact me offering a 45 days voucher (half of what I paid for)

There is no time window for this. It has been almost a week now. As far as I understood, I could not get a refund until this happens, assuming this is true.

Review.Titre: Has to be a better one out there
Review.Contenu: After first downloading ClearVPN, I was able to change my location, although it would always default to the same one.  Then, it changed from an international location to one within the US, requiring an upgrade to Premium for full features.  Now, I am unable to change at all.  The settings tell me that my "connection is off" but there is no way to turn it on.  I have purchased the Premium package but that did nothing to turn the connection on.  Contacting support I received one return message indicating that I should reinstall, which I have several times without any difference.  I get no further response from support.  I would definitely say to stay away from this one.

Review.Titre: ClearVPN is not really a VPN
Review.Contenu: ClearVPN is not really a VPN. A VPN encrypts your traffic and sends it through an intermediary server. Thus it hides your location, allows you to access content regardless of geographical location, and hides and protects your data - ALL AT ONCE. ClearVPN does NOT do all of this. It purposefully allows you to only choose one of these features at a time while connected. It does this by purposefully exposing your data depending on which option you have selected at the time. ALSO, when you select "hide your location" it doesn't actually hide your location. Just run any IPv6 IP Location test online and you will see that it does NOT hide your location. I set ClearVPN to rout my traffic through the US, but it doesn't work. Every IP address location test online shows my REAL location. Not only that, but ClearVPN automatically changes the server location so that you can't select a static location. It switches from USA to Africa to EU all by itself, thus changing your location while you're online. That completely defeats the purpose of the service. This "VPN" is not a true VPN, and should not be trusted under any circumstances.[update} In response to ClearPVN (below) all I have to say is that they know damn well that when you rout your traffic through someone else's servers (which is what a VPN does) it covers your IP address automatically. Thus there is no reason to force customers to choose either "hide my location" or "brows securely and privately," or "unlock streaming services." If you're routing your traffic through the USA, for example, you can already access USA Netflix. You don't have to have separate features. You're purposefully giving up people's personal data and you know it. Not only is your product totally worthless, but I've lost respect for MacPaw entirely. How could you please such a transparently dishonest, and worthless product?
it N-E-V-E-R workstotally a trash

Clear VPN is great on all devices, but...
Review.Contenu: Very happy with Clean My Mac and Clear VPN. Great software. Clear VPN is running on four of my devices, but I think on one of my two mac-mini's (both are running Monterey 12.6) Clear VPN isn't configured properly.  On one, my connection speed is 400-600 MB/s with or without VPN active. On the other, my speed is 20-30 MB/s when VPN is active and 400-600 when VPN is off. On the first, configuration for VPN was automatic upon installing the app. So, how to configure the other installation for optimum speed? Not certain how to do this so I will seek tech support.

Review.Titre: This VPN is very simple to use and has…
Review.Contenu: This VPN is very simple to use and has a very simple UI. It allows the user the freedom to surf the web privately and allows the user to also change their location. However, I did accidentally uninstall it and when I reinstalled it, the VPN didn't allow me the option to change my location. Instead, it offered two same options to surf the web privately.  I like being able to change the location of my IP address, that way if there is a local cyber criminal physically close to me they won't be able to access my approximate location. That's the only issue I have had with this VPN and it's minor really. I'm sure I'll be able to contact the developer and find a solution. It's so easy to use!
